results.title: Advanced panel beating and paint work
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Panel & paint”.
Provides instructions for the serious amateur panel beater. Demonstrates advanced techniques beyond basic repairs including correct methods for replacing door skins and quarter panels and windscreen fitting. Outlines two pack paint application discussing mixing, spray equipment and safety concerns. Features John Llewellyn.

results.title: Advanced editing
results.creator_credit: KTV Productions, John A. Givins and Lynn John
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Video tech”.
Focuses on advanced editing principles and the editing suite including the Beatcam editing suite, the S-VHS edit bench, how to assemble and insert edits, the mixing of sound including voice overs, graphics, sound effects and sound mixing.

results.title: Adults as learners. No. 2 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Roger Owen and Anthony Cash
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Teaching Adults”.
Demonstrates in a machine shop situation how blind workers are taught. A practising artist explains to a group of varying ages and educational background the fundamentals of abstract art.

results.title: Adults as learners. No. 1 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Roger Owen and Anthony Cash
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Teaching Adults”.
Examples of formal teaching and teaching by discovery with two groups of British Railways workers learning elementary electricity. A lesson on chess for a beginner, by the discovery method, is used to support the discussion.

results.title: Adult development
results.creator_credit: Coastline Community College, Rachel Rosenthal and Harry Ratner
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
For all of us, adult life is full of transitions and turning points. How do adults develop psychologically? Do their changes follow some set course, or is their growth varied and unpredictable? This program examines the major transitions in adult life - leaving home, parenting, mid-life crisis and retirement, by interviewing both psychologists and adults going through each of these stages.

results.title: Adriana Lecouvreur
results.creator_credit: Opera Australia, ABC-TV (Australia), John Copley and Hugh Davidson
results.brief_description: Recorded live at the Sydney Opera House on 18 February 1984 this performance of Francesco Cilea’s ” Adriana Lecouvreur” features the grand voice of Dame Joan Sutherland, along with John Shaw, Anson Austin and Heather Begg, The Australian Opera Chorus and The Elizabethan Sydney Orchestra conducted by Richard Bonynge. Set in four acts, it tells the tragic story of a Parisian actress, Adriana Lecouvreur. “This is an excellently sung, played and staged production of this lovely, lyrical opera”…(The Canberra Times). Sung in Italian with English subtitles.

Set in four acts, it tells the tragic story of a Parisian actress, Adriana Lecouvreur. “This is an excellently sung, played and staged production of this lovely, lyrical opera”…(The Canberra Times). Sung in Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Adrian
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Office of Intellectual Disability Services and Allan Kidston
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Early Intervention Series”.
Adrian shows how children with developmental delay can be successfully integrated in kindergarten with cooperation between parents, kindergarten staff and the Early Intervention Program.
